member.name: P:SharpGLTF.Memory.MemoryImage.SourcePath
member.summary:
Gets the source path of this image, or null.
⚠️ DO NOT USE AS AN OBJECT ID ⚠️ see remarks.

remarks.para:
Not all images are expected to have a source path.
Specifically images embedded in a GLB file or encoded with BASE64 will not have any source path at all.
So if your code depends on images having a path, it might crash on gltf files with embedded images.
If SourcePath has a value, it may be relative or absolute depending on the read context.

member.name: M:SharpGLTF.Schema2.PunctualLight.SetColor(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Defines the light color, intensity and range for the current .
member.param: RGB value for light's color in linear space.

Brightness of light in. The units that this is defined in depend on the type of light. point and spot lights use luminous intensity in candela (lm/sr) while directional lights use illuminance in lux (lm/m2)

Hint defining a distance cutoff at which the light's intensity may be considered to have reached zero. Supported only for point and spot lights. Must be > 0. When undefined, range is assumed to be infinite.

member.name: T:SharpGLTF.Schema2.PropertyPath
member.summary: The name of the node's TRS property to animate, or the of the Morph Targets it instantiates. For the property, the values that are provided by the sampler are the translation along the X, Y, and Z axes. For the property, the values are a quaternion in the order (x, y, z, w), where w is the scalar. For the property, the values are the scaling factors along the X, Y, and Z axes.

member.name: P:SharpGLTF.Schema2.LogicalChildOfRoot.Name
member.summary:
Gets or sets the display text name, or null.
⚠️ DO NOT USE AS AN OBJECT ID ⚠️ see remarks.
member.remarks:
glTF does not define any rule for object names.
This means that names can be null or non unique.
So don't use for anything other than object name display.
If you need to reference objects by some ID, use lookup tables instead.

with T: for Scale and Translation keys.
with T: for Rotation keys.
with T: for Morph targets (limited to 8 weights).

member.name: P:SharpGLTF.Schema2.Material.IndexOfRefraction
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of refraction.

remarks.para: The index of refraction (IOR) is a measured physical number usually in the range between 1 and 2 that determines how much the path of light is bent, or refracted, when entering a material. It also influences the ratio between reflected and transmitted light, calculated from the Fresnel equations.
This property backs KHR_Materials_IOR extension.

member.name: T:SharpGLTF.Schema2.Node
member.summary: A node in the node hierarchy. When the node contains `skin`, all `mesh.primitives` **MUST** contain `JOINTS_0` and `WEIGHTS_0` attributes. A node **MAY** have either a `matrix` or any combination of `translation`/`rotation`/`scale` (TRS) properties. TRS properties are converted to matrices and postmultiplied in the `T * R * S` order to compose the transformation matrix; first the scale is applied to the vertices, then the rotation, and then the translation. If none are provided, the transform is the identity. When a node is targeted for animation (referenced by an animation.channel.target), `matrix` **MUST NOT** be present.

member.summary: Merges all the instances into a single big one.

remarks.para: When merging the buffers, it also adjusts the BufferView offsets so the data they point to remains the same.
If images are required to be included in the binary, call before calling .

member.exception: .Net arrays have an upper limit of 2Gb, so this is the biggest a buffer can normally grow, so attempting to merge buffers that sum more than 2Gb will throw this exception.

member.name: M:SharpGLTF.Schema2.ModelRoot.IsolateMemory
member.summary: Refreshes all internal memory buffers.
member.remarks: instances can be created using external arrays, which can potentially be shared with other instances. Editing these arrays directly can lead to data corruption. This method refreshes all internal memory buffers, by copying the data into newly allocated buffers. This ensures that at this point, all memory buffers are not shared and of exclusive use of this instance.

member.param: The name of the new root node, if it needs to be created.
member.remarks: This method is appropiate to apply a general axis or scale change to the whole model. Animations are preserved by encapsulating animated nodes inside a master basis transform node. member.name: T:SharpGLTF.Transforms.AffineTransform
member.summary:
Represents an affine transform in 3D space, with two mutually exclusive representantions:
As a 4x3 Matrix. When is true.
Publicly exposed as .
As a Scale/Rotation/Translation chain. When is true.
Publicly exposed as: , , .

remarks.para:
Depending on how structures are created, the underlaying
fields must be interpreted as a Matrix4x3 or a Scale/Rotation/Translation chain.

This approach allows preserving the source transform, avoiding loosing
precission when decomposing a matrix, or creating a matrix from a SRT chain.

Decomposing matrices is tricky because not all valid matrices can be decomposed; in particular
squewed matrices will fail to decompose. See .

member.name: F:SharpGLTF.Transforms.AffineTransform._Representation
member.summary:
Determines what's represented by the data fields:
- Not defined.
- Fields must be interpreted as a 4x3 Matrix.
- Fields must be interpreted as a Scale, Rotation and Translation chain.

member.name: T:SharpGLTF.Transforms.SparseWeight8
member.summary: Represents a sparse collection of non zero weight values, with a maximum of 8 weights.
member.remarks:
is being used in two different contexts:
As an utility structure to define per vertex joint weights in mesh skinning.
As an animation key in morph targets; a mesh can have many morph targets, but realistically and due to GPU limitations, only up to 8 morph targets can be blended at the same time.
Constructors are designed so weightless values are not taken into account,
and duplicated indices are merged, so indices are expected to be unique.
Use static Create* methods to construct instances of .

member.summary: Creates a new from a weights collection. If there's more than 8 non zero values, the 8 most representative values are taken.

member.summary: Defines validation modes for reading files.

member.name: F:SharpGLTF.Validation.ValidationMode.Skip
member.summary: Skips validation completely.

remarks.para: This mode is intended to be used in scenarios where you know the models you're loading are perfectly valid, and you want to skip validation because you want to speed up model loading.

Using this mode to force load malformed glTF models is not supported nor recomended, because although the loading will not give any errors, it's impossible to guarantee the API will work correcly afterwards.

member.name: F:SharpGLTF.Validation.ValidationMode.TryFix
member.summary: In some specific cases, the file can be fixed, at which point the errors successfully fixed will be reported as warnings.

member.name: F:SharpGLTF.Validation.ValidationMode.Strict
member.summary: Full validation, any error throws an exception.

remarks.para: This is the default mode. glTF ecosystem is still a [WIP] and evolving, so it's still fairly common that many exporters around generate malformed glTF models, which is better to catch early on loading to prevent causing further issues or misleading errors downstream. That's why although validation slows down loading time, I strongly encourage keeping validation enabled.
